title: Race to beat tariffs: 21% jump in exports to US; some exporters weigh discounts to cushion impact
content: Indian exports to the US surged by 21% due to frontloading in anticipation of Trump's tariffs, overshadowing overall export growth. While exporters are offering discounts to retain business amidst uncertainty, concerns remain about sustaining operations if tariffs reach 50%. Industry leaders are seeking government support to mitigate potential job losses, particularly in the MSME sector.

title: 'EC must first affirm voter list is clean, then we'll comply': INDIA bloc steps up attack
content: The INDIA bloc has criticised the Election Commission. Opposition leaders allege misconduct in recent elections. They question the special revision of electoral rolls in Bihar. Concerns were raised about voter list irregularities in Maharashtra and Karnataka. Trinamool Congress leader Mahua Moitra called for dissolving the Lok Sabha. The opposition demands accountability from the Election Commission.

title: Arjun Tendulkar engaged to Saaniya Chandok: How has Sachin's son performed on the field?
content: Arjun Tendulkar, son of cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar, recently got engaged to Saaniya Chandok, who hails from a prominent Mumbai business family. The private, family-oriented ceremony marks a joyous occasion for both families.

title: Mumbai rains: Heavy showers flood roads tracks, bring city to standstill - video
content: Mumbai was hit by torrential rainfall, leading to severe waterlogging and traffic disruptions across the city. Several areas recorded over 100 mm of rain in just six hours, paralyzing transportation and prompting school closures.

title: Moody's chief economist thinks the US is on the verge of recession has...
content: Amidst rising recession fears, Moody's Analytics chief economist Mark Zandi offers a glimmer of hope for tech professionals. Despite troubling economic indicators like flatlined consumer spending and contracting manufacturing, Zandi highlights the tech sector's resilience. Factors such as persistent AI demand, cloud infrastructure investment, global hiring flexibility, and digital transformation spending are expected to insulate the industry.

title: 'India like shining Mercedes': Pak interior min echoes Munir's crude analogy
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi has escalated tensions with India by repeating a controversial analogy made by Army Chief Asim Munir, comparing India to a “shining Mercedes” and Pakistan to a “dump truck.” This statement, initially made during a Saudi delegation visit aimed at de-escalating border tensions, has drawn criticism.

title: 'You’re Tharoor in saree': Priyanka shares humorous moment - see how Shashi responded
content: Priyanka Chaturvedi's podcast banter with Smika Prakash, referencing Shashi Tharoor, sparked a witty exchange online. Chaturvedi, part of a delegation highlighting India's anti-terrorism stance post-Operation Sindoor, emphasized representing the nation abroad despite being a vocal opposition member domestically. She also criticized the Election Commission of India, expressing concerns about eroding public trust and perceived bias towards the BJP.

title: How CEO Jensen Huang's son, daughter make Nvidia Silicon Valley's first 'family business'
content: Jensen Huang's children are now executives at Nvidia. Madison Huang leads the Omniverse division. Spencer Huang oversees AI model development. They both started as interns. Madison's rise has been rapid. Colleagues note their different leadership styles. Other employees' children also work at Nvidia. Jensen Huang addressed nepotism concerns during a company meeting. He expressed confidence in these hires.

title: Exclusive | 'Don't underestimate Shubman Gill' - Harbhajan Singh
content: With the Asia Cup 2025 squad set to be announced, Harbhajan Singh has backed Shubman Gill for inclusion despite stiff competition from India’s power-hitters. Bhajji insisted Gill’s solid basics and adaptability make him a potential T20 dominator. Calling this a “new era” without Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma, Harbhajan praised the youngsters for carrying forward Indian cricket’s legacy.

title: 9-year-old girl dies due to 'brain-eating amoeba' in Kerala
content: A nine-year-old girl from Thamarassery, Kerala, succumbed to a brain infection. The infection was due to Naegleria fowleri. Health officials confirmed the death. This is the fourth reported case in the district this year. Authorities are investigating the source of the infection. Experts advise caution when swimming in freshwater. They also recommend using sterile water for nasal cleaning.

title: Watch: Bhuni toll plaza vandalised following assault on army jawan
content: An Army jawan, Kapil Kavad, was assaulted at Bhuni Toll Plaza in Meerut, triggering a violent reaction from villagers. They stormed the toll, vandalizing property and confronting staff. Police have arrested four individuals and deployed a heavy force to the area, while CCTV footage is being reviewed as part of the ongoing investigation.

title: Microsoft's new return to office plan: Company requires 3-day office attendance
content: Microsoft will require employees near its Redmond headquarters to work in the office at least three days a week starting in January 2025, potentially leading to resignations. This shift reverses previous flexibility and aligns Microsoft with other tech giants mandating in-office attendance. Employees view the policy as a possible "stealth layoff" amid concerns about office space and resources, despite the company's strong financial performance.

title: ‘Another war may happen’: Khamenei’s aide warns US, Israel
content: A top advisor to Iran's Supreme Leader warned that renewed conflict with the U.S. or Israel could erupt anytime, escalating regional tensions. Yahya Rahim Safavi emphasized Iran's need to bolster its defenses across all sectors. This warning follows reported Israeli strikes on Iranian command centers and U.S.

title: Harjinder Singh faces deportation: Trucker took reckless U-turn in Florida that killed 3
content: A tragic accident on the Florida Turnpike resulted in three fatalities after a minivan collided with a tractor-trailer executing an illegal U-turn. Harjinder Singh, the truck driver and an undocumented immigrant, faces vehicular homicide charges for allegedly causing the devastating crash near Fort Pierce. The collision occurred when Singh's trailer blocked all lanes, leaving the minivan with no chance to avoid impact.

title: Mumbai rain mayhem: 9 flights abort landing; city waterlogged, trains affected
content: Mumbai experienced significant disruptions due to heavy rainfall, impacting air and road travel. Several flights faced landing difficulties, with some forced to go around or divert. Commuters faced waterlogged roads and slow-moving traffic, prompting travel advisories from airlines.

title: Trump-Zelenskyy meet: Will Ukrainian prez finally suit up after WH wardrobe drama?
content: Volodymyr Zelenskyy is expected to adopt a more formal appearance during his upcoming meeting with US President Donald Trump in Washington, according to a designer who has previously collaborated with him. This shift comes after criticism of his informal attire during a previous visit to the White House.

title: Watch: Children stuck in school bus on flooded Mumbai road; rescued
content: In Mumbai, a school bus with six children and two staff members became stranded in a waterlogged street due to heavy rains. Promptly responding to the emergency, police officers arrived at the scene and successfully rescued all the passengers. Following the rescue, the children were safely transported to the Matunga Police Station.

title: Ranthambore guide abandons vehicle mid-jungle in dark; 3 vehicles, drivers banned
content: Following a concerning incident where tourists were left stranded in Ranthambore forest due to a vehicle breakdown and subsequent failures in assistance, authorities have banned three safari vehicles, their drivers, and a guide.

title: 'War 2' box office live: Hrithik Roshan, Jr NTR starrer starts slow
content: Released on August 14th amidst a clash with 'Coolie', 'War 2' initially lagged behind, earning ₹51.5 crore on its first day. However, boosted by Independence Day, day 2 collections surged to ₹56.50 crore, crossing ₹100 crore in all languages. While the Hindi version rebounded strongly, the Telugu version saw a significant drop over the weekend, with total collections reaching ₹175.

title: Netaji 'fled fearing British'? Kerala's SCERT corrects textbook error
content: Kerala's SCERT corrected a historic error in a Class 4 teachers' handbook that wrongly stated Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose 'fled fearing the British' before forming the INA. The mistake was flagged by teachers and quickly removed, prompting an internal inquiry. The controversy sparked criticism from the ABVP, accusing the Kerala government of distorting history and undermining national unity. Complaints have been filed demanding strict action and better oversight of educational materials.

title: Delhi horror: Man rapes mother twice
content: In a shocking incident in Delhi's Hauz Qazi, a 39-year-old man has been arrested following allegations of raping his 66-year-old mother. The victim, along with her daughter, reported the crime to the police, stating the assaults occurred after their return from a pilgrimage.

title: Princess Anne's 75th Birthday: William and Kate share a simple message with a new portrait
content: Princess Anne celebrated her 75th birthday, marked by a newly released portrait and a simple birthday wish from the Prince and Princess of Wales. The imagery and messages emphasized her dedication to service and her understated style.

title: ‘Racist’: Swatch ad outrages China; watchmaker apologises over ‘slant-eye’ gesture
content: Swatch, a Swiss watchmaker, faced criticism in China. An advertisement was deemed racist. It showed an Asian model pulling his eyes. This gesture offended many Chinese social media users. They called for a boycott. Swatch apologised and removed the ad globally. However, many felt the apology was insufficient.

title: Asia Cup 2025: SKY to stay as India’s T20I captain, Gill likely to miss out
content: India are set to back Suryakumar Yadav as T20I captain for Asia Cup 2025, with Shubman Gill and Shreyas Iyer likely to miss out despite stellar form. Samson, Abhishek Sharma, and Tilak Varma remain first-choice batters, while Jasprit Bumrah returns to lead the attack. Mohammed Siraj is expected to be rested, with Prasidh Krishna and Washington Sundar among likely inclusions.

title: Woman’s father runs over couple on bike; man killed, daughter injured
content: In Madurai, a man was killed after being run over by his girlfriend's father, who disapproved of their relationship. The couple, who had previously eloped, were targeted after leaving a police station following a dispute over alleged stolen jewelry. The woman is hospitalized, and her father has been arrested for planning the murder.

title: Tariff war: It’s time to buy India, not sell, says Jefferies’ Wood
content: Jefferies' Christopher Wood advises investors to buy Indian equities, anticipating Trump will back down from tariff threats, which are not in America's interest. Wood highlights India's recent underperformance and high valuations but notes its tendency to rebound after such periods.

title: Putin’s bodyguards allegedly carried ‘poop suitcase’ for his meeting with Trump
content: Reports indicate that Vladimir Putin's bodyguards collect his fecal waste in a special "poop suitcase" during foreign trips, including his recent meeting with Donald Trump in Alaska. This practice, reportedly dating back to 1999, aims to prevent foreign powers from analyzing his health.

title: Man stabs ex-girlfriend’s new lover; says he was ‘unwilling to accept breakup’
content: In Bengaluru, a 26-year-old salesman named Yatish, fueled by anger over his girlfriend's breakup and new relationship, orchestrated a stabbing attack on his rival, Chandan Gowda, near Jataka Stand. Yatish, along with his brother Harsha, has been arrested for attempted murder after Chandan was rushed to the hospital with stab wounds to his chest and abdomen.

title: How did police recover 295 medals of Bula Choudhury? Padma Shri brooch still missing
content: Former swimming legend Bula Choudhury's stolen medals have been recovered by Chandannagar Commissionerate and CID, forty-eight hours after she reported the theft at her Hindmotor house. A total of 295 medals, along with idols and medals stolen in 2014, were found.

title: ‘Stop buying Russian crude oil’: Trump adviser tells India
content: A Trump administration advisor has urged India to cease purchasing Russian crude oil, asserting that India is strengthening ties with Russia and China. Peter Navarro suggests India's actions undermine its strategic partnership with the US.

title: Voter 'chori' claim: INDIA bloc to bring impeachment notice against CEC?
content: Following Rahul Gandhi's allegations of vote irregularities in Karnataka, the Congress party is considering strong actions against Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar, who demanded an apology or affidavit from Gandhi. Opposition parties are contemplating an impeachment motion against Kumar during the Monsoon Session, accusing him of bias towards the BJP.

title: Omaha basketball star dies: 22-year-old Deng Mayar drowns in Utah
content: Deng Mayar, a basketball player at University of Nebraska-Omaha, passed away in a drowning incident in Utah. The incident occurred at Blackridge Reservoir. Mayar was swimming with a friend, Sa Mafutaga, who survived. Emergency crews recovered Mayar's body after an extensive search. University leaders, coaches, and teammates expressed their grief. Mayar had recently transferred to Omaha from North Dakota.

title: Bold statement! 'India vs Pakistan Asia Cup match nahi hoga' - Watch
content: Former Indian cricketer Kedar Jadhav predicts that the highly anticipated India vs Pakistan Asia Cup 2025 match will not occur. This statement aligns with Harbhajan Singh's earlier sentiment, advocating for India to boycott playing Pakistan, prioritizing national interests following recent terror attacks. Singh emphasized that the sacrifices made by soldiers outweigh the importance of a cricket match.

title: Arjun Tendulkar’s fiancée Saaniya Chandhok spotted in old video with Sara Tendulkar
content: An old video of Sara Tendulkar with Saaniya Chandhok, Arjun Tendulkar's fiancée, has resurfaced, showcasing their close bond. The video, originally shared in August 2024, captures the trio enjoying a day at a petting zoo and pig farm in the UK. This resurfaced clip highlights Saaniya's long-standing connection with the Tendulkar family, prior to her recent engagement to Arjun in a private ceremony.

title: Stock market: Sensex rallies over 1,000 points on GST reforms push, S&P upgrade; Nifty50 crosses 24,950
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, soared in trade on Monday on the back of next-generation GST reforms announced by PM Modi during his Independence Day speech, and S&P Global's credit rating upgrade.

title: 'Big day at White House': Trump rules out Nato, Crimea hopes for Ukraine; focus on Zelenskyy
content: Donald Trump stated that Volodymyr Zelenskyy could end the Russia-Ukraine war quickly. He suggested Ukraine should not pursue NATO membership. Trump also mentioned Crimea's annexation under Barack Obama. Several European leaders are expected to visit the White House. This visit occurs before Zelenskyy's meeting with European leaders and NATO. Concerns arose after Trump met Vladimir Putin without Zelenskyy's presence.

title: Jabalpur bank heist: How robbery was planned inside CG jail
content: In a brazen daylight heist, the Khitola bank robbery was orchestrated from within Raigarh jail, Chhattisgarh. Police have apprehended four suspects, including Raees Singh Lodhi, the mastermind, but the 15 kg of stolen gold remains unrecovered. The gang, involving local accomplices and a Jharkhand-based group, meticulously planned the crime, utilizing rented accommodations and motorcycles for their escape.

title: Untold tale: Sunil Gavaskar could get away with murder - Ex-teammate
content: Karsan Ghavri revealed Sunil Gavaskar's unwavering focus, recalling an instance when Gavaskar prioritized his batting concentration over meeting then Prime Minister Morarji Desai. Ghavri also highlighted Gavaskar's infamous slow innings in the 1975 World Cup, where he defied team expectations and played at his own pace, frustrating teammates with his unconventional approach.

title: Delhi’s new school fee law: Why it's not as simple as it sounds
content: The Delhi School Education (Transparency in Fixation and Regulation of Fees) Bill, 2025, aims to regulate fees in all private schools across the city by involving parents in fee fixation and grievance redressal committees. The law introduces penalties for unauthorised fee hikes and grants enforcement powers to the Director of Education. While the government highlights increased transparency and parental participation, parent groups protest the bill, demanding greater accountability and public consultation.

title: 'Greg Chappell caused insecurity in the team': Irfan Pathan reveals untold story
content: Irfan Pathan reflects on Greg Chappell's tenure as India's coach, acknowledging personal benefits but noting the cultural clash. Chappell's aggressive communication, emphasizing performance-based selection, created insecurity within the team. Pathan believes Chappell's intent was positive but his failure to adapt to Indian culture ultimately hindered his success, a crucial lesson in coaching.

title: Vice presidential poll: Nitish Kumar's JD(U) backs NDA's candidate CP Radhakrishnan
content: Janata Dal (United) president Nitish Kumar has pledged his party's support to NDA's vice-presidential candidate, CP Radhakrishnan. The BJP nominated Radhakrishnan, currently the Governor of Maharashtra, aiming for a unanimous election. Prime Minister Modi lauded Radhakrishnan's dedication and intellect, highlighting his extensive community service. The vice-presidential election follows Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation, with polling scheduled for September 9.

title: 'She is a very good mother': Sunjay Kapur's sister praises Karisma Kapoor
content: Following the unexpected death of business tycoon Sunjay Kapur, his sister, Mandhira Kapur, has publicly commended his ex-wife, Karisma Kapoor, for her excellent parenting and dedication to maintaining family unity. Mandhira emphasized Karisma's efforts to keep the family connected, particularly for the sake of her children, amidst ongoing family tensions regarding control of the Rs 30,000 crore company.

title: Illegal tree felling threatens Vaniyanthal lake nesting site in Kallakurichi
content: The tree felling has been continuing over the past few days and nearly 30% of the total 900 trees in and around the lake have been cut, according to environmentalists.

title: Supreme Court asks if NHAI ought to compensate commuters for fuel, patience in 12-hour traffic snarl in Kerala
content: Supreme Court questions NHAI on compensating commuters for 12-hour traffic snarl caused by overturned truck on NH 544

title: 15 lakh families in Karnataka ineligible for BPL cards, process of weeding them out to begin after monsoon session of legislature
content: He acknowledged that 3.22 lakh families have applied for BPL cards, but they are yet to get the cards

title: Letter row in CPI(M): Kerala Minister M.B. Rajesh alleges attempts to defame him ahead of elections
content: Minister says similar allegations had surfaced against him ahead of the previous Assembly election as well

title: SC judge K. Vinod Chandran recuses from hearing plea over AMU V-C’s appointment
content: The top court was apprised about Ms. Khatoon becoming the vice-chancellor (V-C) after getting the key vote of her husband who was then the V-C of AMU.

title: National Cooperation Policy 2025 detrimental to Kerala’s cooperative sector: Kerala Cooperative Employees’ Union
content: KCEU to take out Raj Bhavan march and district-level protests on August 20 in protest against the policy

title: Lok Sabha discusses Shubhanshu Shukla’s space mission: Indian on moon will herald Viksit Bharat in 2040, says Jitendra Singh
content: After opening up the space sector for private players in 2020, India’s space economy has already reached $8 billion and would touch $45 billion in the next decade, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said

title: Kerala’s Food Minister hints at further coconut oil price cuts ahead of Onam
content: G.R. Anil says crucial meeting to be held at Supplyco headquarters in Kochi to deliberate on potential price cuts

title: Flood warning issued to 11 districts in Tamil Nadu
content: The warning was issued to Salem, Erode, Namakkal, Karur, Ariyalur, Tiruchi, Thanjavur, Tiruvarur, Mayiladuthurai, Nagapattinam, and Cuddalore districts.

title: Online applications invited from farmers for crop competition under agriculture awards scheme in Karnataka
content: Interested farmers and women-farmers must submit their applications separately through the Agriculture Department’s K-Kisan portal

title: NDA's V-P candidate Radhakrishnan meets PM Modi
content: Mr. Radhakrishnan is expected to be felicitated at the meeting of the NDA parliamentary party on August 19, 2025

title: Kerala accuses Centre of withholding ₹2,601-crore MSP dues owed to paddy farmers
content: Kerala Food and Civil Supplies Minister says Centre has withheld a total of ₹2,601 crore owed to State paddy farmers, including ₹1,259 crore pending since the 2017-18 fiscal year, and ₹1,342 crore for paddy procured in the 2024-25 procurement season

title: DKS flaunts restored Yezdi on new loop of Hebbal flyover in Bengaluru
content: Loop on Hebbal flyover in Bengaluru inaugurated, expected to ease traffic congestion for vehicles heading from K.R. Puram to Mehkri Circle

title: Debate rages in Kerala over stray dog control as rabies takes a toll on lower-income groups
content: In Kerala too, where public concern has been mounting over growing stray dog population and rising rabies deaths, animal rights activists face bitter opposition from families who have lost their children to the disease

title: Many Kolleru Lake bed villages facing flood threat in Eluru district
content: Police arrange pickets as flood water rises at Penumakalanka, Peddayedlagadi, Kovvadalanka, Takkellapadu and other island villages in Kaikalur and Mandavalli mandals

title: Chief Election Commissioner’s press briefing raises more questions than providing answers to issues highlighted by INDIA bloc: T.N. CM Stalin
content: “If ‘Fair Elections’ is truly the aim of the ECI, why can’t it be more transparent and voter-friendly?,” posed Mr. Stalin who is also the DMK president.

title: DRG Jawan killed, three injured as IED planted by Maoists explodes in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur
content: The explosion occurred in the morning in Indravati National Park area when a team of DRG, a unit of the State police, was out on an anti-Maoist operation, a senior official said

title: Death threat to Kamal Haasan: TV actor moves Madras High Court seeking anticipatory bail
content: Says, the words uttered by him regarding, slitting of throat, during a YouTube interview were “unintentional”

title: Row over letter leak: CPI(M) gears up to counter Congress-BJP ‘slander campaign’ against top leadership in Kerala
content: Saying ‘absurd questions do not merit answers’, CPI(M) Kerala secretary M.V. Govindan declines to comment on whether Polit Bureau received a confidential letter detailing alleged financial nexus

title: Karnataka rain: Farmers of ‘toor bowl’ stare at losses following excess rainfall
content: Vast tracts of pulse fields in Kalaburagi and surrounding districts face destruction after 15 days of incessant rains lashing the region. To add to the problem, farmers who insured their crops under the Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana are facing a new hurdle

title: T.N. BJP, Tamil Maanila Congress urge INDIA bloc to support C.P. Radhakrishnan’s candidature for Vice-President post
content: G.K. Vasan  said Mr. Radhakrishnan being chosen as an NDA candidate for the post of Vice-President was a ‘proud moment for Tamil Nadu and Tamil language’.

title: ‘Kodi’ Suni, convict in T.P. Chandrasekharan murder case, shifted from Kannur Central Jail to Tavanur prison
content: Shifting follows reports of misconduct, including allegations of drinking on Thalassery court premises. A prison department report earlier stated Suni was using mobile phone inside jail and was involved in illegal activities outside

title: U.P. school mergers: Supreme Court asks AAP MP to move High Court against order to merge low-enrolment schools
content: The Rajya Sabha MP had said the State’s order had adversely affected the educational access of numerous children

title: Andhra’s Eluru SP urges public vigilance amid heavy rains, flood threat
content: The SP noted that the Godavari river, streams, canals, and nearby low-lying areas are witnessing heavy water flow, creating a risk of flooding

title: Election Commission of India makes public names of 65 lakh people deleted from Bihar voter list during SIR
content: ECI is publishing the names of ‘ASD’ (Absentee, Shifted, and Dead) voters across polling booths, and is likely to do so online as has been directed by the apex court

title: Madras High Court takes special steps to dispose of petty criminal cases pending in Tamil Nadu, Puducherry
content: The goal is to reduce the clogs in the wheels of administration of criminal justice and ensure availability of quality time for trial of appropriate cases

title: Andhra Minister Nara Lokesh meets Union Minister Jaishankar; seeks support for various initiatives
content: Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Nara Lokesh requested S. Jaishankar to help positioning Andhra Pradesh as a frontrunner in India’s global workforce vision

title: Supreme Court stays HC order reversing discharge of T.N. Minister I. Periyasamy in DA case
content: The Minister has argued that these cases were products of the political rivalry, referring to a similar disproportionate assets case registered against him and his family concerning tax returns between 1996 and 2001

title: Government introduces Jan Vishwas (Amendment of Provisions) Bill in Lok Sabha, refers to Select Committee
content: Introducing the Bill, Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the Bill seeks to enhance trust-based governance for ease of doing business

title: Tamil Nadu MPs should support C.P. Radhakrishnan for Vice-President post: Edappadi Palaniswami
content: All MPs, shedding their political differences, should back Radhakrishnan, urged the AIADMK general secretary

title: Rajya Sabha MP Tiruchi Siva Likely To Be Opposition's Veep Candidate: Sources
content: The Opposition is likely to pick the DMK's Rajya Sabha MP Tiruchi Siva as its Vice-Presidential candidate, in a strategic move that would pit the Tamil Nadu politician against another from his state in the upcoming election.

title: 4.3 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Parts Of Assam
content: An earthquake of 4.3 magnitude hit Assam's Nagaon on Monday, making it the seventh quake in the state this month and the third in the district, an official said.

title: Teen Gets 500 Stitches After Dog Attack, Asks Mother, "Am I Still Pretty?"
content: A California teenager, mauled by a pack of dogs last month, asked her mother if she was "still pretty" moments after the attack.

title: Podcaster Calls Team Uddhav MP "Shashi Tharoor In Saree". He Responds
content: A prominent podcaster's "Shashi Tharoor in a saree" comment on Rajya Sabha MP Priyanka Chaturvedi has drawn a witty response from the senior Congress MP. Mr Tharoor has said he considers himself "flattered" with this comparison with the fellow MP.

title: "What An Experience": Indian Woman's Driverless Car Ride With Parents In US
content: An Indian woman living in San Francisco has introduced her parents to an autonomous car. Apurva Bendre, a dancer, shared a video showing her parents seated in the back of the driverless vehicle, smiling as they enjoyed the ride.

title: "Matter Of Social Justice": Supreme Court Flags Struggles Of Disabled Army Cadets
content: The bench of Justices BV Nagarathana and R Mahadevan called the issue "unfortunate" and said that even if they don't get ex-serviceman status, measures should be taken to ensure their rehabilitation.

title: "Tell Putin We Will Destroy Russian Economy": US Senator's Advice To Trump
content: The US must leverage its economic power against Moscow to end Russia's war in Ukraine, Senator Lindsey Graham has said. He urged President Donald Trump to expand tariffs on nations that buy Russian oil.

title: Opinion: Opinion | In Musk vs Altman, The Winner Might Just Be A Third Guy - Of Indian Roots
content: Is the tail trying to wag the dog to build Aravind Srinivas's Perplexity? Or is it because the "other giants" in this tech race like to lift a David on their shoulders to fight a Goliath like ChatGPT?

title: Mamata Banerjee Likely To Skip PM Modi's Kolkata Metro Inauguration On August 22
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is likely to skip the inauguration of three Kolkata metro projects by Prime Minister Narendra Modi on August 22, a top state government official said on Monday.

title: Supreme Court's "2-Hour Rain Paralyses Delhi" Remark In Kerala Highway Case
content: Delhi becomes paralysed if it rains for two hours, remarked Chief Justice BR Gavai, while a colleague commented on a Kerala instance that travellers must be compensated if they are stuck in a jam for 12 hours on a national highway.

title: "They Were Kids, Probably 16-19 Years": Indian Man Attacked With Knife In Ireland
content: A 22-year-old Indian man who was recently harassed with racist slurs and assaulted with a knife by three teenagers in Ireland has narrated the turn of events that left him injured while returning home.

title: Tourism Deal Puts One Of Egypt's Last Wild Shores At Risk
content: In Egypt's Wadi al-Gemal, where swimmers share a glistening bay with sea turtles, a shadowy tourism deal is threatening one of the Red Sea's last wild shores.

title: "India Most Enthusiastic To Transform With AI": OpenAI's Sam Altman Tells Zerodha's Nikhil Kamath
content: Asked how India could move from being just a consumer of AI to becoming a producer of such tools, Altman said the shift was "already happening in a big way."

title: Over 100 Film Crew Members Hospitalised For Food Poisoning In Leh
content: More than 100 workers of a film unit have been hospitalised here due to food poisoning, an official said on Monday, describing their condition as stable.

title: Srinagar-Jammu Highway Closed, Schools Shut Due To Heavy Rain, Landslides
content: The Srinagar-Jammu highway was closed for traffic after heavy rain triggered landslides and shooting stones in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district. Hundreds of vehicles were stranded on the highway.

title: One Killed In Bomb Blast Near School In West Bengal, Probe Underway
content: One person was killed in a bomb explosion outside a school in West Bengal's North 24 Parganas district on Monday, police said.

title: "Illegal Immigrant": Team Trump After Indian-Origin Man's Wrong U-Turn Kills 3 In US
content: Three people were killed on Florida's Turnpike on Saturday after a semi-truck made an illegal U-turn, causing a collision. The tragic incident also set off a tornado of racist taunts thrown at the Indian-origin driver.

title: US Mom Arrested For Placing Loaded Gun In Child's School Backpack
content: A Florida mother has been arrested after reportedly sending her child to school with a loaded gun concealed in their backpack and giving them instructions to "return" it to their father.

title: Video: Mumbai School Bus Shut Down On Flooded Road, Cops Come To Rescue
content: As Mumbai battles rain chaos, a heartwarming video of cops rescuing children from a stranded school bus is making the rounds on social media

title: Video: Men In Black SUVs Block Gurugram-Delhi Highway, Dance To Loud Music
content: A 19-second viral video starts with a man sitting on the car top, grooving to the background music while looking into the camera.

title: Supreme Court says injured trainee cadets cannot be left ‘high-and-dry’, seeks Centre’s response
content: The Court suggested the government could consider providing injured cadets for alternative training and posts in the Armed Forces after their medical treatment

title: Air India cancels Zurich-Delhi flight citing technical issue
content: In the last two days, Air India has cancelled at least two flights, including one international, at the last moment, citing technical reasons

title: Kerala rains: IMD sounds orange alert for two districts, yellow for seven
content: Presence of strong westerlies over Kerala fuelled by the low-pressure area is expected to cause widespread rains across parts of central and north Kerala for the next few days

title: Supreme Court affirms HC order quashing FIR in Mohan Delkar death case
content: The Bombay High Court, in 2022, had quashed the case against nine persons in the abetment of suicide case of former Lok Sabha MP Mohan Delkar in 2021

title: Low pressure over Bay of Bengal likely to intensify; heavy rains forecast for Andhra Pradesh
content: Under its influence, coastal Andhra Pradesh is expected to receive widespread rains, with heavy to very heavy rainfall at isolated places. Rayalaseema districts may witness light to moderate showers

title: Search for missing enters fifth day in cloudburst-hit J&K’s Kishtwar village despite heavy rain
content: Rescue teams brave rain and debris to search for missing persons after cloudburst in Chisoti, Jammu and Kashmir

title: 32 children, a teacher hospitalised after van accident in Kerala’s Thiruvananthapuram
content: Incident raises questions about safety of transporting children to schools, especially in crowded private vans, cars and autorickshaws

title: SIR is ‘new weapon’ of ‘vote chori’, will protect ‘one person, one vote’, says Rahul Gandhi
content: The "collusion" of BJP and Election Commission is punishing them for being 'Bahujan' and poor — even our soldiers were not spared, Mr. Gandhi said

title: Tungabhadra Aarti Utsav at Huligi in Karnataka on August 26 to be organised on grand scale by Huligemma Devi Temple Development Authority
content: Koppal MLA K. Raghavendra Hitnal said that the Huligemma Devi Temple Development Authority is celebrating the Tungabhadra Aarti on such a grand scale for the first time

title: INDIA bloc considering impeachment motion against CEC Gyanesh Kumar
content: Parliament can remove the CEC by a motion with two-thirds majority in both Houses; for the motion to be accepted, at least 50 members have to sign in favour of it

title: K.C. Venugopal seeks urgent action to ease highway congestion in Kerala
content: Venugopal urges Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan to deploy more police personnel to regulate traffic on highways

title: India’s purchase of Russian crude funding war in Ukraine, has to stop: U.S. trade adviser Navarro
content: “India acts as a global clearinghouse for Russian oil, converting embargoed crude into high-value exports while giving Moscow the dollars it needs,” Peter Navarro said in an opinion piece published in the Financial Times

title: Ahead of Wang Yi’s arrival, Congress flags Beijing’s support to Pakistan during Operation Sindoor
content: India has agreed to "buffer zones" in Galwan, Hot Spring, and Pangong Tso that lie within the Indian claim line, said Jairam Ramesh

title: Water tank collapse at Eranhiparambu in Kerala’s Kozhikode floods houses, worsens water shortage
content: One of the concrete walls of the square-shaped tank gave way, producing a loud noise that alerted local residents

title: BJD supremo Naveen Patnaik stable, likely to be discharged on August 18: Hospital source
content: The former Odisha CM Patnaik was admitted to SUM Ultimate Medicare, Bhubaneswar, on August 17, 2025 due to dehydration

title: Kannagi statue in Chennai: an embodiment of justice and wrath caught up in controversy
content: A character in the epic Silappadhikaram, Kannagi is known for cursing the city of Madurai and burning it down as revenge for the unjust execution of her husband Kovalan

title: Parliament Monsoon session Day 18 LIVE: Indian Ports Bill, 2025 passed in Rajya Sabha
content: Opposition walked out in the Rajya Sabha demanding a discussion on the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls in Bihar; INDIA bloc parties, meanwhile, are considering an impeachment motion against CEC Gyanesh Kumar

title: Flight of stairs at Chennai’s Rajaji Hall where intense scenes in Tamil cinema unfold
content: The Rajaji Hall, with its grand colonial-era architecture, has become a popular shooting locale. Many iconic scenes from yesteryear hits such as Thalapathi and Alexander were filmed here

title: Five men electrocuted to death, four others injured during Krishna Shobha Yatra in Hyderabad
content: The mishap was reported around midnight during a Krishna Janmashtami procession being carried out by locals

title: Gaana music: a versatile art form that steals Chennai’s heart
content: With its thumping rhythm, easy lyrics, and quick beats, Gaana music captures not only the essence of the lives of the working class but also the struggles of marginalised communities, particularly those from the city’s northern areas

title: How ‘honour’ killings in India are reinforced and legitimised
content: States like Tamil Nadu, Telangana, Maharashtra, and Kerala — where Dalit communities have seen relatively greater empowerment — record higher rates of inter-caste marriages. Ironically, these are also the States with increased incidents of honour killings

title: Student found dead in hostel of BITS Pilani Goa campus; cops launch probe
content: The police were informed and have initiated the required procedures to ascertain the cause of death, and "we are fully cooperating", the institute said

title: Weekend rush and incessant rain add to pilgrims’ woes in Tirupati
content: The Tirumala temple is bursting at its seams as several make unplanned visit; heavy demand for seats in private buses bound for Hyderabad and Bengaluru

title: Social justice is ensuring that one section of community is not traditionally involved in garbage disposal: Thirumavalavan
content: Mr. Thirumavalavan rued the slander faced by the Viduthalai Chiruthaigal Katchi and pressure exerted to leave the DMK alliance

title: 20 tourists left stranded by guide in Ranthambore tiger safari; probe ordered
content: Three canter drivers and the guide have been barred from entering the park till the probe is completed, Deputy Conservator of Forests (DCF) Pramod Dhakad said

title: Delhi-bound Air India flight aborts take off at Kochi airport due to technical issue
content: The matter came to light after Ernakulam MP Hibi Eden posted on social media that the aircraft in which he was travelling with family seemed to have skidded off the runway while attempting to take off

title: Snag in Air India’s Delhi-bound flight from Kochi; MP flags safety concerns
content: The matter came to light after Ernakulam MP Hibi Eden posted on social media that the aircraft in which he was travelling with family seemed to have skidded off the runway while attempting to take off

title: Maharashtra CM Fadnavis, his Deputy CMs congratulate Radhakrishnan over V-P nomination
content: “Radhakrishnan’s selection as the Vice-Presidential candidate fills us all Maharashtrians with immense pride” says Maharashtra CM

title: IndiGo flight makes sudden ‘go around’ at Assam’s Guwahati airport
content: A go-around, also known as a missed approach or aborted landing, is a procedure where an aircraft, during its final approach or after touchdown, discontinues its landing attempt and climbs back into the air for another approach or diversion

title: Dasara elephants on special diet as rehearsals gather pace in Mysuru
content: As part of the rehearsals, they will be carrying sandbags weighing nearly 500 kg to start with, which will gradually be increased to reach a maximum of about 1,000 to 1,200 kg

title: Omaha forward Mayar dies in drowning incident
content: Omaha Mavericks forward Deng Mayar, who transferred from North Dakota this offseason, died Saturday in a drowning incident.

title: Sources: DFA'd by Nats, Lowe set to join Red Sox
content: Veteran first baseman Nathaniel Lowe, 30, designated for assignment by the Washington Nationals earlier this month, and the Boston Red Sox are finalizing a deal, sources told ESPN, paving the way for him to join one of the strongest lineups in baseball.

title: Vols name Aguilar starting QB after Iamaleava exit
content: Joey Aguilar was named Tennessee's starting quarterback Sunday, beating out redshirt freshman Jake Merklinger for the job.

title: M's Robles ejected for throwing bat at AAA pitcher
content: During his rehabilitation assignment with Triple-A Tacoma on Sunday, Mariners veteran outfielder Victor Robles was ejected from a game in Las Vegas, after he was nearly hit by an inside pitch and tossed his bat at starting pitcher Joey Estes.

title: Howell, 18, wins U.S. Amateur; youngest since '09
content: Mason Howell, 18, capped a productive summer before his senior year of high school by winning the U.S. Amateur at The Olympic Club on Sunday. He's the third-youngest U.S. Amateur champion ever.

title: Scheffler wins BMW, fifth PGA Tour crown of '25
content: Scottie Scheffler erased a four-shot deficit in five holes then delivered a haymaker on the daunting par-3 17th by chipping in from 82 feet for birdie that carried him to victory Sunday in the BMW Championship for his fifth PGA Tour title of the year.

title: Johnson praises Williams: Bears QB 'locked in'
content: Bears quarterback Caleb Williams put together a sharp preseason debut Sunday night that capped his best stretch of training camp and earned praise from coach Ben Johnson.

title: Sources: Jaguars acquire DT Saunders from Saints
content: The Jaguars have acquired veteran defensive tackle Khalen Saunders from the New Orleans Saints for veteran center Luke Fortner, sources confirmed.
